phys.org/2015/04/why-do-measurements-of-.title: Why do measurements of the gravitational constant vary so much?
phys.org/2015/04/why-do-measurements-of-.snippet: ()Newton's gravitational constant, G, has been measured about a dozen times over the last 40 years, but the results have varied by much more than would be expected due to random and systematic errors.
